answers.answer: You could request a referral to a University medical center.Dr. O.
what do you think could be the reason for this?
It could be a inner ear infection, or sinus problems.. Possibly just dry eyes. Google is king.

question: Hi all ,i recently notice my vision is shaken. when i focus specially on some design patterns its getting shaken. i recently diagnosed diabetes type -2 and my blood sugar level is under control. i get scared i met a optomologist and they test said nothing then they refer me to neurologist they have check my optic nerve and brain MRI said nothing found. im completely alright.but still my vision is shaking. im worrying a lot about it. can anyone help me?im taking rozavel 10mg and glycomet 250mg one time (night) in a day for my diabetic.. i recognize after i take this pills this symptoms has taken, even now im not taking the medicines regularly this symptoms hasn't gone. im working in IT. and diabetic found some 5 month back and symptoms starts 4 months back.i do wear .25 spectacles. pls i badly need helping hands on this. since im having marriage in another couple of month and this hectic problem raised. no doubt about the MRI and opthamologist they are top university hospitals in the city. any one can help me?
title: Shacky vision not EYE
